prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Curved Side The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism has dimensions of 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The Euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch for the first face (face_1) of the prism.** The sketch should have a loop (loop_1) consisting of the following curves: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2782, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.2782, 0.0], End Point [0.2782, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.2782, 0.75], End Point [0.2047, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.2047, 0.75], End Point [0.2047, 0.572] - Line 5: Start Point [0.2047, 0.572], End Point [0.0401, 0.572] - Line 6: Start Point [0.0401, 0.572], End Point [0.0401, 0.75] - Line 7: Start Point [0.0401, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Note**: Loop_1 consists of 8 line curves in total. Scaling and Transformation 3. **Scale the 2D sketch (face_1) using the sketch_scale scaling parameter.** The scaling parameter is 0.75. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector.** Use the same coordinate system as defined at step 1. Extrusion 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model.** Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0111 units and set the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0 units. The resulting part should match the provided description. The length of the prism is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.0111 units. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units. The boolean operation for this part is to create a new solid body (NewBodyFeatureOperation).</description>
